page.title: 16WALKER DRIVE HOME
page.content: This{home for the mentally handicapped is one of{five in County Durham}and is situated in the centre of the Woodhouse Close Council Estate. It caters for{mentally handicapped ladies from{South-West Durham.}Opened in 1965, it has accommodation for twenty-seven in twenty-three single and two double rooms. It is staffed by eleven people:- Matron, deputy, house parents and domestics and at present has twenty-five residents, ranging in age from twenty-two to fifty-eight. During the day, all the ladies work at a nearby{Training Centre}and in their spare time they usually knit or sew, but every Monday evening they hold a "disco". The ladies get very few visitors but but all go away for at least a week in every year. They often go to the{Leisure Centre}and all seem to enjoy living in the home.
